sub_title: Co Founder and Managing Director at WonderBoom.Tech
summary:
I’m currently working as a freelance Business Analyst and providing Business Analyst Training for  BACoach Netherlands. I have over 8 years BA experience on a wide variety of projects for both Asset Finance and Retail Banking. 

The projects I worked on included compliance projects such a Money Laundering and Know your client to name a few. Other projects I worked on involved system innovation, application processing, call center improvements, automation of financial journals, process automation and Human Resources score cards. I also contributed to the development of Junior BAs and processes to enhance the quality of the BA team deliverables in both Agile and Waterfall methodologies.  

As a proactive team player I enjoy working with people & contributing to my team’s success in challenging & fast paced work environments.


Qualifications 

•	Degree: Bachelor in Technology: Business Administration (Honors)
•	ACI: Financial Markets
•	Masters Certificate in Business Analysis, George Washington University
•	Certificate in Banking: Institute of Banker South Africa

Strengths

•	Agile Methodologies
•	Banking
•	Banking Legal and Compliance projects
•	IT Business Analysis
•	Business Process Modeling 
•	Business Strategy
•	Change Management
•	Caching, Mentoring and Training Junior Staff
•	Communication Skills: Written, oral and presentation
•	Data Analysis 
•	Data Modeling 
•	Economics and Financial Markets
•	Forecasting and Trend Analysis
•	Project Management
•	System Development and Life Cycle (SDLC)

awards.title: Biometric Project
awards.description:
The Biometrics  project was initiated to identify ways to use a client’s Biometric information to improve a client’s onboarding experience while ensuring the clients Identification is 100% correct. 

The Biometric system formed part of Nedbank’s client onboarding system, IBS. The IBS system was used across all Divisions of Nedbank and had 20000 daily users. The Biometrics system was linked to the South Africa Department of Home Affairs and their database was used to identify clients.

By including the Biometric process into the client onboarding process Nedbank ensured that they were aligned to KYC and Money Laundering legislation. It also ensured the automatization of  backend processes and required fewer staff to manage client documentation.

awards.title: Project successes: Added 21 million rand to MFC bottom line
awards.description: I was tasked with identifying specific income leakage and institute a project to address it. I identified leakage in Non-Interest Revenue (NIR) and by addressing the leakage the project added R21 million to MFC bottom line.

awards.title: MFC and Nedbank Integration
awards.description: I formed part of the MFC, Nedbank VAF integration team. The Team was tasked with integrating the two Businesses to ensure the two business becomes profitable. After the integration of the two Businesses Nedbank VAF went from making a R400 Million loss to making a R600 Million profit in the next financial year.

awards.title: Talent Management Program
awards.description: I was chosen to attend the Nedbank Vehicle and Asset (VAF) Talent Management Training program. In the grogram we were broken up into teams and taken through the VAF division.

awards.title: BA Training Program through UJ
awards.description:
I was selected a part of a group of 30 students from across the Nedbank group to attend a specialized Business Analyst course at the University of Johannesburg. 

I completed the dege in 2012

awards.title: Capital Team of the year
awards.description: In 2002 I worked on the Foreign Exchange Commercial Desk at Nedbank. The team won the best Trading desk for the year as we made 180 Million Rand for the Financial Year.

awards.title: Mercantile Bank Student Management Program
awards.description: I applied to work at Mercantile Bank in 1997 as my 1st Banking job. I was the only student chosen from my collage to attend the program where I was finally placed in Treasury as a Money Market Dealer.

projects.title: Protection of Personal Information Act
projects.description:
Project Type: Legal and Compliance 

The Protection of Personal Information Act by requiring that public and private bodies comply with certain standards when collecting, processing, storing and sharing clients personal information.

My Contribution to the MFC Project Team

•	Understand the “new” legislation and its impact on Nedbank and MFC
•	Review processes, systems and system generated documentation to ensure they all aligned to the “new” legislation.
•	Discuss findings and Elicit Business Requirements from business. This was done in Workshops, JAD sessions, one on one meetings and research. I managed the collection of both Functional and Non Funtional Requirements
•	Develop the following Artifacts for the Project Team.
	Develop Scope of Work
	Business Management Documents BMD/DRS
	Gap Analysis 
	Change requests 
	Process Modelling (UML and BPMN)
	Systems/Database Architecture
•	Review and Signoff updated Process Models form Process Engineers
•	Review and Signoff Test Cases.
•	Review and Signoff Change Management processes
•	Review and Signoff on internal communications updating staff on the change

contributors.headline: Co Founder and Managing Director at WonderBoom.Tech

projects.title: Implementation of the New Companies Act Legislation
projects.description:
Project Type: Legal and Compliance

The purpose of this Act is to: Promote compliance with the Bill of Rights as provided for in the Constitution in the application of company law. Promote the development of the South African economy by encouraging entrepreneurship and enterprise efficiency.

My Contribution to the MFC Project
•	Understand the “new” legislation and its impact on Nedbank and MFC
•	Review processes, systems and system generated documentation to ensure they all aligned to the “new” legislation.
•	Discuss findings and Elicit Business Requirements from business. This was done in Workshops, JAD sessions, one on one meetings and research. I managed the collection of both Functional and Non Functional Requirements
•	Develop the following Artifacts for the Project Team.
	Develop Scope of Work
	Business Management Documents BMD/DRS
	Gap Analysis 
	Change requests 
	Process Modelling, "Unified Modeling Language (UML)" & "Business Process Model and      Notation (BPMN) 
	Systems/Database Architecture
•	Review and Signoff updated Process Models form Process Engineers
•	Review and Signoff Test Cases.
•	Review and Signoff Change Management processes
•	Review and Signoff on internal communications updating staff on the changes.

contributors.headline: Co Founder and Managing Director at WonderBoom.Tech

projects.title: Nedbank  - MFC Integration Project
projects.description:
The acquisition of Imperial Bank ‘s (MFC) by Nedbank was a strategic decision by Nedbank to strengthen the Vehicle Asset and Finance Division of Nedbank to compete against First Rand Group’s WesBank. 

My role in the MFC project is to integrate and reengineer the MFC Businesses Processes to work within the constraints of the Nedbank Back-end systems, whilst trying to ensure the competitive advantage of MFC.  The role has seen me engage with the head of Bancassurance, ensuring that the strategic systems are in place for the business to continue to cross sell value added products and services as accompaniments to vehicle finance. I have also engaged with MIS teams to create requirements to ensure the continued delivery of successful MIS to the organisation and have engaged with senior members of Collection and Recoveries ensuring the relevant collection and recovery systems are updated and integrated into the NedBank back-end system

profile_positions.description:
I’ve been working as a Freelance Business Analysis , I’ve also worked presenting corporate Business Analysis Training  on behalf of BAcoach. 

My functions as Business Analyst included the following:

•	Understanding the business and what problem or opportunity the company is trying to address and gather the functional requirements to achieve their goal. This is done by analyzing procedure documents, business processes, operational scenarios , running workshops and meeting business representatives and stakeholders.
•	Understanding the business, operational and project landscape to ensure project dependencies are identified and managed effectively.
•	Acting as a springboard for the project Stakeholders, Customers, Product Owners, operational and the project team as a whole. Acting as a liaison officer between the business and outside vendors/parties.
•	Ensuring the functional business requirements are met and the project delivers what the business wants and needs.
•	Translating the business requirements into a language the IT department can understand.
•	Managing, prioritizing and monitoring requirements throughout the system development  lifecycle. Reporting back to the stakeholders on how the project is progressing. Ensuring missed functional requirements are catered for and developed. 
•	Providing input, reviewing & signing off test cases. Ensuring the requirements are met by doing testing.
•	Providing input & signing off the Change Management process to ensure impacted staff know what to expect.
•	Providing input & signing off internal communications informing staff of system changes.
•	Mentoring and managing Junior Business Analysts within the BA team.
profile_positions.title: Business Analyst and BA Trainer

profile_positions.description: The company is a document solutions company aimed at the Banking sector within the European Union. The company provides a secure document  and data exchange service for EU Banks to transfer specified documents safely between institutions.
